question: Who was the administrator/organizer of the "World Series Cricket" competition?
explanation: Kerry Packer was the administrator/organizer of the "World Series Cricket" competition. World Series Cricket (WSC) was professional cricket competition staged between 1977 and 1979 and organized by Kerry Packer for his Australian television network, Nine Network. A breakaway competition, the matches ran in opposition to established international cricket. World Series Cricket drastically changed the nature of cricket, and its influence continues to be felt today.
